title: Professional Competency Enhancement Program via Comparative Companion Animal Counseling Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic veterinary medicine and pharmacology knowledge
context.additional_context: Conducted in a limited technological environment based on smartphones, focusing on cultivating practical skills through real counseling case applications

learning_goals: Learners can explain comparative medical knowledge about major pet diseases with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners apply essential information (dosage, side effects, interactions) required for pet prescription consultations through three or more practical assignments.
Based on learned content, learners can create and share two or more educational materials (CIS) for pet owners on online platforms.
Through group collaboration, learners can develop three pet-related consultation scenarios and refine them according to evaluation criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
